adjective.description: In the theories of T. W. Kingsmill and A. C. Haddon: designating any of various southern Mongolian peoples from whom some of the peoples of mainland and insular South-East Asia are thought to be descended.

noun.description: A member of any of these southern Mongolian peoples.

origin: Early 20th century. From para- + ancient Greek ἑῷος eastern (from ἕως dawn: see eo-) + -an.
